markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Peachwood Talisman](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1542)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=155" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 20</row>

**Price** 40 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>envision</row></row>

 

 

**Requirement** You are an expert in Perception
</row>

</column>

---

Symbols of good fortune and luck are carved on this thin, square wooden plaque. It smells of sandalwood from the blessings placed upon it. After activation, for the next minute, you can sense attacks from [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). You aren't [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22), [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39), or flanking undead of your level or lower, or undead of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Peachwood Talisman
requirement: You are an expert in Perception
requirement_markdown: You are an expert in Perception
